contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{Politics of French Guiana}} '''Disputes - international:''' [[Suriname]] claims area between [[Litani River, South America|Litani River]] and [[Marouini River]] (both headwaters of the [[Lawa River, South America|Lawa]]) '''Illicit [[Recreational drug use|drug]]s:''' small amount of [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]] grown for local consumption; minor [[transshipment]] point to [[Europe]]. In May 2012 Brazil sent troops to guard its border with [[Brazil-France relations|France]] (Guiana).<ref>[http://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/04/world/americas/brazil-sending-more-troops-to-guard-amazon-borders.html Brazil Sending More Troops to Guard Amazon Borders] May 3, 2012</ref> ==See also== * [[French Guiana]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Foreign relations in South America}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Foreign Relations Of French Guiana}} [[Category:Government of French Guiana]] [[Category:Foreign relations by country|French Guiana]] [[Category:Foreign relations of France|French Guiana]] {{Foreignrelations-stub}} {{FrenchGuiana-stub}}
